item.title: Duplicate Case Label [PI] Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:4, topic:419664”] case 1530: //fishing guild door if (c.objectX == 2611 && c.objectY == 1/*Add Y here.*/) { if (c.absX < c.objectX) { c.getPA().walkTo(1,0); } else { c.getPA().walkTo(-1,0); } } if (c.objectX == 2551 && c.objectY == 1/*Add Y here.*/) {//door to cooking house at skills if (c.absX == 2551 && c.absY == 3098) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2551, 3097, 0); } else { c.getPA().movePlayer(2551, 3099, 0); } } break;

It is possible. Anything is possible.[/quote]
That’s exactly what I said to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Duplicate Case Label [PI] Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Okay so yeah title says it all, I’m trying to add 2 cases and their the same case yeah…and by case I mean they are the same door. Both 1530 and it’s pissing me off I’ve been trying to find out how to make them not say that but have gotten no where, if you could help me make this code(BOLD) be able to also work with this one (ITALIC)

[b]case 1530: //door to cooking house at skills if (c.objectX == 2551) { if (c.absX == 2551 && c.absY == 3098) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2551, 3097, 0); } else { c.getPA().movePlayer(2551, 3099, 0); } } break; [/b]
			<blockquote>[i]case 1530: //fishing guild door
		if (c.objectX == 2611) {
			if (c.absX < c.objectX) {
				c.getPA().walkTo(1,0);
			} else {
				c.getPA().walkTo(-1,0);
			}
		}
	break;[/i]</blockquote>

Read full topic
